title: 2024 Q3 India recent development | News Summary
selftext:
All know India is experiencing significant development across various sectors. Here are some key highlights from recent developments 2024 Q3:

# Economic Growth

* [**Fastest Growing Major Economy**: India continues to be the world’s fastest-growing major economy, with a growth rate of 8.2% in FY23/24](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview). This growth is driven by public investment in infrastructure and rising household investments in real estate.
* [**Manufacturing and Services**: The manufacturing sector grew by 9.9%, while the services sector remained resilient](https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2024/09/03/india-s-economy-to-remain-strong-despite-subdued-global-growth).

# Poverty Reduction and Human Development

* [**Poverty Reduction**: Between 2011 and 2019, India halved the share of its population living in extreme poverty](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview). However, the pace of poverty reduction slowed during the COVID-19 pandemic.
* [**Human Development Index (HDI)**: India ranks 134 out of 193 countries with an HDI value of 0.644](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview). The country has also made progress in reducing gender inequality.

# Trade and Global Integration

* [**Trade Goals**: India aims to reach $1 trillion in merchandise exports by 2030](https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2024/09/03/india-s-economy-to-remain-strong-despite-subdued-global-growth). To achieve this, the country is focusing on diversifying its export basket and leveraging global value chains.
* [**Global Standing**: India surpassed the UK as the fifth-largest economy and is on track to overtake Japan and Germany by 2027](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview).

# Challenges and Opportunities

* [**Employment**: While headline employment indicators have improved, concerns remain about the quality of jobs and low female labor force participation](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview). Recession in IT sector and increasing opportunities for Semiconductor & Electronics is highlight.
* [**Climate Resilience**: India is committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2070 and is focusing on climate-resilient growth](https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/india/overview).
